entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as someone who had bustled off to check on the Polyjuice Potion again. She is described as having a plan that went smoothly.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as turning to Harry with a doom-laden expression and later whispering ecstatically about Crabbe and Goyle's stupidity.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as someone who had perched the chocolate cakes on the end of the banisters and hid behind a suit of armour next to the front door with Ron.

entities.name: polyjuice potion
entities.description: The Polyjuice Potion is mentioned as something Hermione had bustled off to check on again.

entities.name: crabbe
entities.description: Crabbe is mentioned as someone who remained alone at the Slytherin table and later pointed out the chocolate cakes to Goyle.

entities.name: goyle
entities.description: Goyle is mentioned as someone who remained alone at the Slytherin table with Crabbe and later stuffed the chocolate cakes whole into his mouth.

entities.name: slytherin
entities.description: Slytherin is mentioned as a house where Crabbe and Goyle remained alone at the table.

entities.name: chocolate cakes
entities.description: The chocolate cakes are mentioned as something Harry perched on the end of the banisters and later Crabbe and Goyle ate greedily.

entities.name: entrance hall
entities.description: The Entrance Hall is mentioned as a place where Harry and Ron lurked in after Christmas tea, waiting for Crabbe and Goyle.

entities.name: great hall
entities.description: The Great Hall is mentioned as a place from which Crabbe and Goyle came out of to spot the chocolate cakes on the banisters.

relationships.description: Ron was amazed by how stupid Crabbe and Goyle were for eating the chocolate cakes whole without checking if they were poisoned.
Harry was also amazed by how stupid Goyle was for eating the chocolate cakes whole without checking if they were poisoned.
